newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan new-crop cotton rates up on mill demand.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan new-crop cotton rates up on mill demand.

text.p: Pakistan's new-crop cotton rates rose on Saturday as demand by mills outpaced supplies and are likely to remain stable in the near term, dealers said.

"The prices rose on a strong demand from mills which outstripped the supply," dealer Nasim Usman said. "Until the arrival of new crop picks up in the Punjab (province), the cotton rates would maintain the current levels."
Dealers said the arrival of new crop would pick up in the main growing Punjab province from the first week of September.
In the kerb market, the new-crop NIAB-78 variety was traded around 2,250 rupees ($55.39) per maund (37.32 kg).
Saturday's official spot rates issued by the Karachi Cotton Association in rupees per maund, including a 12.5 percent sales tax:
